messages.message: anybody got the github mobile app authenticated via SSO successfully recently on a new iphone?

I recently emailed IT about this and got this response:

> GitHub falls under our apps that require Zscaler (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IT/pages/1968668673/ZScaler+The+Complete+Requirements+List) in order to access, so it is only available via your corporate laptop. We haven’t vetted out support for it on mobile devices at this time.
I got the same response last night, but odd thing is that it has been working on my old phone with no problem
Strange, it must’ve been grandfathered in
if your github app was authenticated before this policy was rolled out, it would continue to work.  however, new installation of apps would stop

It’s the auth where it hits the zscaler requirement, so as Shaunak notes that sounds entirely expected. We’re happy to work with some interested parties to see what we need to allow list to make this functional, I just think we didn’t get that critical mass in the past
I’ll follow up on those tickets to collect the names of some interested parties and see if we can get enough testers together.
I would love to volunteer for this @Dave :slightly_smiling_face: I have had intermittent needs to use GitHub on mobile, but I also understand the security aspects of it being on the mobile device.
@derrick.smith @samantha.pettley this might be something where Peelo needs to tie into the device cert stuff from Okta now that we have it
Thanks @shaunak we’d certainly like to do it, we just need to vet the secure ways to do it
